content: go all around the heel so we will pick them up next in a kind of set-up round whatever method you are using for knitting your socks an extra dpn will definitely come in handy here with needle 1 k the 9 remaining sts from the heel turn with the extra dpn or any other spare nee- dle pick up all the slipped sts along the left side of the heel flap the easiest way will be to pick up just the outer leg of each stitch and you should pick up half as many sts as you have worked row in your flap so if you have worked the suggested 40 row you should pick up 20 slipped sts if you have done this correctly the sts will sit on the spare needle in the opposite orientation to regular knit sts with needle 1 knit all of these sts since they were sitting twisted on the needle knitting them through the front will twist them which is desired as it will prevent any holes from forming you are now at the bottom of the heel flap where your instep sts are waiting to be worked it is very easy for a hole to form at this spot where flap and instep form a right angle so to help preventing this pick up an extra st from the thread coming out of that first instep stitch knit half of the instep sts 16 in the sample onto needle 1 with needle 2 knit the remaining 16 instep sts again pick up an extra st in the corner with your spare dpn pick up the outer leg of the slipped sts along the right side of the heel flap this time the sts will sit in the regular orientation on the needle so to twist them you will need to knit them through the back loop be very careful to pick up the same number of sts that you have picked up on the other side finish this set up round by knitting the 9 heel turn sts to get you back to the centre of the sole if you count your sts on the needle you should have 9+20+1+16 =46 sts on each needle making a total of 92 sts since you were supposed to knit your socks with 64 sts we need to do something to get back to that number and that s what the gusset is for gusset a gusset is basically just a triangular piece that aids in increasing or reducing material since knitting is so flexible and stretchy it could theoretically be positioned anywhere around the foot stranded colourwork designs often place it underneath the foot as to not interrupt the design but for basic socks the classic position is either side of the foot between the sole and the instep i have worked my gusset in reverse stocking st on the anatomy sample on the last page to make it clearly visible but normally
